properties.name: London
properties.description:
London is the capital and largest city of the United Kingdom, standing on the River Thames in southeast England. 

The queen wears a fancy hat here.

properties.name: New York City
properties.description: New York City is the most populous city in the United States, famous for its skyline, culture, and global influence.

properties.name: Tokyo
properties.description: Tokyo is the capital of Japan and one of the world's most populous metropolitan areas, known for its modern architecture and culture.

properties.name: The Henry Ford Museum of American Innovation
properties.description:
Henry Ford decided to buy all of American history and put it in the world's largest indoor-outdoor museum complex (12 acres indoors, 240 acres outdoors). It's an aerospace museum, a living history museum, automobile, railroad, and science museum,Including:

1.) All presidential limosines, including the ones John F. Kennedy and Ronald Reagan were shot in.
2.) The chair Abraham Lincoln was assassinated in.
3.) A 1:1 replica of Independence Hall.
4.) The Wright Brother's Bicycle shop where they developed the first airplane.
5.) Thomas Edison's Menlo Park Laboratory Complex.
6.) Rosa Park's bus.
7.) The homes and farms of Henry Ford, Thomas Edison, and Harvey Firstone.

properties.name: Detroit Institute of Arts
properties.description: See all the art Detroit purchased when it was the richest city in the world. There's also an entire Egyptian tomb and part of a European castle in here.

properties.name: Detroit Historical Museum
properties.description: Remember when Detroit was the 5th largest city in the United States of America and the richest city in the world? This museum sure does. Featuring assembly lines, a recreation of historical Detroit streets - including armored personnel carriers from all those times the Michigan National Guard had to quell riots.

properties.name: Motown Museum
properties.street: 2648 Berry Gordy Jr. Boulevard, 2648 W Grand Blvd, Detroit, MI 48208
properties.description: Music writer and producer Berry Gordy bought a bunch of houses, turned them into a music studio, and approached music production like a Detroit assembly line - turning artists into stars through rigorous trainining and quality control. This museum is where the Jackson 5, Stevie Wonder, Marvin Gaye, The Supremes, and the Four Tops got their start.

properties.name: Cranbrook Educational Community
properties.street: 380 Lone Pine Rd, Bloomfield Hills, MI 48304
properties.description: An Art Deco museum-garden complex created when Detroit was the richest city in the world. Featuring the Cranbrook Art Museum, the Cranbrook Institute of Science, and the Cranbrook House and Gardens.

properties.name: Gilmore Car Museum
properties.description: What's better than one building full of cars? 14 buildings full of cars set in an entire town built just for one car museum. It's 90 acres of cars.

properties.name: Sleeping bear Dunes National Lakeshore
properties.description: 35 miles of 450ft tall sand dunes next to the largest freshwater lakes in the world.

properties.name: Mackinac Island State Park
properties.description: Mackinac Island was the second national park after Yellowstone, but Michigan wanted it back. The state that is the heart of the American automotive industry banned cars on this island to preserve its beauty.

properties.name: S.S. City of Milwaukee
properties.description: The SS City of Milkwaukee is the last railroad ferry on the Great Lakes. It's also a museum, hotel, and haunted house depending on the time of year. The USCGC Acacia is also docked as a museum ship.

properties.name: S.S. Milwaukee Clipper
properties.description: It's museum passenger/car ferry ship built in 1904 and modernized in the 1950s. The resulting ship feels uniquely like a cross between an insane-asylum and a bus.

properties.name: Gerald R. Ford Presidential Museum
properties.street: 303 Pearl St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504
properties.description: Come see the Gerald R. Ford Presidential Museum where you can learn that President Gerald Ford did nothing wrong (in their opinion).

properties.name: Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore
properties.description: It's fancy rocks, waterfalls, sand dunes, and shipwrecks on the world's largest freshwater lake by surface area. The lake is 45F all year round, so enjoy the breeze - but don't go swimming.

properties.name: Top-of-the-Lake Snowmobile Museum
properties.description: Snowmobiles are awesome. I like them. The Upper Peninsula of Michigan is one of the snowiest location in the United States, and the snowmobile trails in the region reflect that.

properties.name: Porcupine Mountains Wilderness State Park
properties.description: Waterfalls, dynamic cliffs, and a lake in the sky (Lake of the Clouds) in this stunning state park.

properties.name: Quincy Mine
properties.description: A Michigan Upper Peninsula Copper mine that remains frightfully cold year round. Part of the Keweenaw National Historical Park.

properties.name: SS Valley Camp
properties.street: 501 E Water St, Sault Ste. Marie, MI 49783
properties.description: Come see a 1917 Great Lakes Freighter in its native habitat: next to a massive set of locks between Lake Superior and Lake Huron. The museum is in the actual cargo hold - a rarity among museum ships in the Great Lakes.

properties.name: U.S.S. Edson
properties.description: The USS Edson is a 1958 Forrest-Sharman class destroyer. U.S. Navy veteran volunteers tend to mull about on deck. Interestingly, this ship museum lets you wander around the engine room with very little restrictions.

properties.name: Air Zoo
properties.description: The Air Zoo is a combined children's amusement park and aerospace museum. The flight simulators let you do barrel rolls and loops and I highly recommend them. Uniquely, the air zoo has a Curtiss Ascender, F-117 Nighthawk, SR-71B Blackbird

properties.name: Sloan Museum
properties.description: 80,000 people used to work in 37 General Motors Automotive Factories in Flint, Michigan. Today that number is less than 8000. All the while General Motors placed its prototypes and successes in this local museum named after the CEO that took General Motors to its zenith when it held 50% market share in the U.S. auto market.

properties.name: USS Silversides Submarine Museum
properties.description: A World War Two Gato-class submarine that sunk 23 enemy ships in the Pacific Theater is now available for tour in Muskegon, Michigan - a place that is most definitely not the ocean.

properties.name: Icebreaker Mackinaw Maritime Museum
properties.street: 131 S Huron Ave, Mackinaw City, MI 49701
properties.description: The Great Lakes freeze during the winter, but ships still need to move. The USCGC Mackinaw is a 1944 icebreaker designed specifically for Great Lakes service to extend the shipping season. As a result it looks unique compared to other icebreakers.

properties.name: Tahquamenon Falls State Park
properties.description: Copper-colored 50ft waterfalls in the rocky wilderness of the Upper Peninsula of Michigan.

properties.name: National Museum of the Great Lakes
properties.description: The National Museum of the Great Lakes features the SS Colonel James M. Schoonmaker, a 1911 Great Lakes iron ore freighter. Despite its nautical appearances, the crew quarters on the stern is lavishly decorated like a Victorian mansion.

properties.name: Rutherford B. Hayes Presidential Library and Museums
properties.description: It's called the Rutherford B. Hayes Presidential Library and Museum, but it should be more accurately titled the "Medal of Honor Recipient Webb C. Hayes Museum, featuring my dad who did nothing wrong: President Rutherford B. Hayes".

properties.name: Cedar Point
properties.description: 19 World class rollercoasters on the eleventh largest freshwater lake in the world. Winner of Best Amusement Park In The World for 16 consecutive years. Featuring multiple rollercoasters that have all been ranked as best in the world at the time of their opening.

properties.name: National Museum of the United States Air Force
properties.description: This is THE military aviation museum. The largest military aviation museum in the world with 360 aircraft and missiles on display. Come see presidential aircraft, nuclear missiles and bombs, stealth fighters and bombers, spy satellites, experimental aircraft, and friendly recruiters who would like you to join the United States Air Force. Admission is free.

properties.name: Cincinnati Museum Center
properties.description: The train station that was the basis for DC's Hall of Justice is now a museum center. Somehow there is an entire steamboat (complete with historical waterfront), cave, ice cave, and forest in the basement. Also dinosaurs, mummies, and astronauts. It is just as glorious as it sounds.

properties.name: Columbus Zoo and Aquarium
properties.description: Jack Hanna's legendary zoo with 800 species of animals, including manatees, lions, leopards, tigers, elephants, lynxes, sea lions and seals, cheetahs, sea turtles, penguins, koalas, moose, river otters, pallas cats, polar bears, etc. There's also two rollercoasters and an outstanding waterpark built into the zoo.

properties.name: Cuyahoga Valley National Park
properties.description: Cuyahoga Valley National park doesn't look like much until you peer into the 65ft deep rocky ravine filled with 100 waterfalls. Brandywine Falls by itself is a stunning attraction that is well worth a look.

properties.name: Wordens Ledges
properties.street: Wordens Ledges Loop Trail, Hinckley, OH 44233
properties.description: Terrifying century old rock visiages carved into the face of a cliff deep in the woods. I genuinely felt I was going to get murdered despite being in the safe suburbs of Cleveland.

properties.name: Serpent Mound
properties.description: Native Americans built a giant snake shaped mound on top of a hill more than 2000 years ago. It's still there snaking in the woods.

properties.name: Warren G. Harding Presidential Library and Museum
properties.description: President Warren G. Harding promised to "Return to Normalcy" and "Make America Great Again" following American overseas interventionism, enforced political correctness, percieved weakness on immigration, and a plague. A favorite of newspaper reporters due owning his own newspaper where the country could hear his thoughts, Harding also presided over a corrupt cabinet, womanized, then died of a heart attack after being strained from touring the country for massive rallies. This is his museum and tomb.

properties.name: McKinley Presidential Library and Museum
properties.street: 800 Mc Kinley Monument Dr NW, Canton, OH 44708
properties.description: President William McKinley followed the proud presidential tradition of being from Ohio and getting shot - which means his tomb is very nice because the nation was very sad. For some reason there's also dinosaurs in his museum.

properties.name: The Cleveland Museum of Art
properties.description: Cleveland used to be rich, bought a lot of nice art, and made the art museum free forever. Yes, they have the Etruscan Boar Vessel and the Majapahit piggy bank.

properties.name: Kings Island
properties.description: The Eiffel Tower, 15 rollercoasters, including a homemade 7361ft ride through the woods. Kings Island is one of the world's greatest amusement parks which revived the public's interest in rollercoasters following the decline of the amusement industry in the 1970s.

properties.name: Hocking Hills State Park
properties.description: Caves and waterfalls, waterfalls in caves, rock overhangs, and gentle hikes. It's like Ohio is trying to trick you into thinking it's a nice place to be.

properties.name: Early Television Museum
properties.description: Did you know you can make a television screen out of a single lightbulb and a spinning disc with holes in it? Learn about the wacky frontier of television when television stations went to bed for the evening, and the British could still manufacture electronics.

properties.name: Trap History Museum
properties.description: 4000 traps of all types and historical periods located next to a public safety equipment supplier to remind them of the consequences should they fail. Come see 20ft giant bear trap that might be our only protection against Godzilla. Tours by appointment only - please call ahead of time.

properties.name: Age of Steam Roundhouse
properties.description: You know how at most railroad museums the trains just sit there and don't do anything? The trains at the Age of Steam Roundhouse actually still run and you can ride in them. They also have a compressed air powered locomotive.

properties.name: The Troll Hole Museum
properties.description: Are you feeling too sane? Why not learn about trolls, see cellebrities turned into rolls, troll based cinema, and find out if Santa is really a troll. It's the world's largest troll collection.

properties.name: Great Lakes Science Center
properties.description: Featuring the NASA Glenn Visitor Center (with an actual Apollo capsule used for Skylab) and the Great Lakes Freighter William G Mather. The rest of the stuff is for kids.

properties.name: Rock and Roll Hall of Fame
properties.description: Memorabilia from history's greatest modern music performers. Located in Cleveland because some radio DJ here created the phrase ''Rock and Roll".

properties.name: Jungle Jims International Market Eastgate
properties.description: Jungle Jims International Market literally has everything. This is the infinite IKEA of grocery stores. Yes there is a movie theater that only shows propaganda promoting the store that you are already in. Yes there is a bar. Yes there is a card game shop.

properties.name: American Sign Museum
properties.description: All the good signs all in a former sign factory. This museum fulfills mankind's truest desire to look at pretty flashing lights in funny shapes.

properties.name: Mansfield Memorial Museum
properties.description: Home of Elektro - one of the first ever robots displayed at the 1939 New Yorks's World Fair. Elektro could walk, talk, smoke a cigarette, blow a balloon, move its arms and fingers, and be enslaved by humanity (something that we will surely never come to regret). This museum isn't the best museum, I just really like Elektro.

properties.name: Crystal Cave
properties.description: Ever wanted to stand in a cave surrounded by crystals like some kind of ancient enchanter? Now you can! There's another cave across the street if you are waiting for the ferry to take you back to the mainland.

properties.name: Ohio Caverns
properties.description: Most caves are all the same color of rock, the caves at Ohio caverns are multi-colored and still wet and drippy. Considering how flat everything is in the area this is the most exciting geological feature for nearly 100 miles in every direction. Breathe it in.
